Description: Copper blade of a battle-axe: with a very narrow waist, a deep rounded cutting end, and elongated lugs. The butt is straight and the corners of the cutting edge are pointed. The blade is lightly corroded. There are scratch marks on one face. The cutting edge bears signs of possible wear.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. Kühnert-Eggesbrecht, ‘Die Axt als Waffe und Werkzeug im alten Ägypten’ (Berlin, 1969), no, G-V/3, pl. XIII, 2 (where it is wrongly identified with DP, pl. XXXII, 25. The latter is actually Philadelphia, UM, E 4662).
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (114)
